analyzer/odb_check/include/ODBCheck.hh

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /************************************
00002 Class: ODBCheck
00003 Author: John R. Quirk
00004 
00005 ODBCheck looks simply for inconsistencies between the alcapana
00006 data quality output histograms and the original ODB files,
00007 then outputs a corrected ODB file for the run to be loaded on the
00008 next alcapana production.
00009 ************************************/
00010 
00011 #ifndef ODBCHECK_H__
00012 #define ODBCHECK_H__
00013 
00014 #include "WireMap.hh"
00015 #include "DataDir.hh"
00016 #include "PulseEstimate.hh"
00017 
00018 #include <string>
00019 #include <fstream>
00020 
00021 
00022 class ODBCheck {
00023 private:
00024   int fRun;
00025   WireMap fODB;
00026   WireMap fCorrections;
00027   DataDir fDataDirs;
00028   PulseEstimate fEstimate;
00029   std::ofstream fCorrectionsFile;
00030 
00031 public:
00032   ODBCheck();
00033   ~ODBCheck();
00034 
00035   // Set the directories to look for the different files we might need. Store in DataDir object.
00036   // The directories are, in order:
00037   // Raw data directory (MIDAS files; input)
00038   // ODB data directory (ODB files; input)
00039   // Histograms directory (hist?????.root files; input)
00040   // Corrections directory (correction*.dat files for rootana; output)
00041   void SetDirs(const std::string& raw, const std::string& odb, const std::string& hist, const std::string& corr);
00042 
00043 private:
00044   // Output the estimates to a correction file (ODB format)
00045   void OutputCorrections();
00046 
00047 public:
00048   /*** The bulk ***/
00049   // Using the histogram output from alcapana, make estimates of the time offset from
00050   // MuSC, the pedestal, and the polarity. Output a corrections file for any
00051   // estimates different from the ODB values and keep track of everything in a trends
00052   // file.
00053   void Check(int run);
00054 };
00055 
00056 #endif
